text: While Willow ponders the reason he received such a weak looking staff, we can see poor Madmartigan hold his sword as if he wants to sleep on its edge, if only he had a good pillow. That pillow was destroyed a few moments before by the evil Queen's spell which had misfired, screaming at her failure to target the hero instead. Meanwhile, the skele-monkey wonders why he has a toy sword. (This was an alright Zelda clone at the time, but I didn't find it memorable)
author: SupraDarky

text: I remember liking the game. It had more cinematic elements to it than a typical Zelda game...and that Capcom sound to the music.

text: No movie epitomizes 80s fantasy quite like Willow for me. In the same vein, the game does a great job of epitomizing that early Gen 3 feel like it's video game counter part.

text: Fun fact: the title of this song seems to a be transliteration of the Russian phrase for "Husband and Wife" (or more accurately "Wife & Husband". Not sure what the context for that is (I don't remember the film that well and never played the game), but there it is.
